This is a problem I had and reported (offlist) earlier in the year.

The bug report:
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1444316&group_id=73833&atid=539099

To abbreviate, this is a bug introduced sometime between 1.5.1 and 1.6.0.
It causes overrides to (at least) URIRegExprFilter to trigger this alert.

Possible solution: Swith from any scope based off ClassicScope to
DecidingScope.

- Kris



--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Gordon Mohr
Sent: 3. ma� 2006 01:27
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re: Lots of Alerts


Hmm, OK, thanks. There may be more information in heritrix_out.log. Can
you look through that file for any SEVERE lines that correspond to the
alerts, and forward those? (They should show the Java class/method where
the SEVERE log event occurred.)

- Gordon @ IA

andlanna wrote:
> No, there are no exceptions or stack trace with the alert. Only this...
> Andr� Lanna
>
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>> I'm not familiar with this problem; is there any more information in
> the
>> Alert -- like a stack trace?
>>
>> - Gordon @ IA
>>
>> andlanna wrote:
>>> Hi there,
>>>
>>> I'm using Heritrix to crawl about 130 domains. It occurs that some
>>> domains needs specials configurations and I'm doing this with
>>> Refinement (one for each site that has this need).
>>>
>>> Basically these refinements are made to restrict the crawler by a URI
>>> RegExp. When a URI matches the regular expression it will not be
> crawled.
>>> But I'm having troubles with this approach, because a great number of
>>> alerts are being generated. The alerts are 2 (they appear many times
>>> during a job):
>>> SEVERE           if-match-return(in processor LinksScoper)
>>> SEVERE           enabled(in processor LinksScoper)
>>>
>>> I'm having memory's troubles (java heap space exceeds) and I think
>>> these alerts may be the cause. At this moment there are more than
>>> 500.000 alerts.
>>>
>>> So, anyone could help me solve this problem? Or how can I modify the
>>> heritrix.properties file to don't launch these alerts?
>>>
>>> Thanks in advance!
>>>
>>> Andr� Lanna
